Title: Bowl with "Kufic" Inscriptions
Inscriptions: [Translation] The loyal person is the most praiseworthy
Description: Ceramic vessels from early medieval Nishapur were frequently decorated with proverbs or short sayings in Arabic.  The proverb here, written in two parts, may be interpreted as: "The loyal person is the most praiseworthy."
CreditLine: Museum purchase with funds provided by the S. & A.P. Fund, 1955
Provenance: H. Khan Monif, New York [no. 2052]; Walters Art Museum, Baltimore, 1955, by purchase.
Creator: Iranian
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Third Floor: Islamic Art
